text: As an update: this is being :eyes: by the powers that be. For some context — I think that the way that this was originally designed, im not 100%, but I believe it was originally intended to simply inherit default values that were set on the target field. Ie. `field_1` has a default value of `blue` --> `field_2` inherits from `field_1` ergo it’s value is `blue`. I don’t think that they were originally designed to be in a watchful state for page editor updates.
It _does_ do the watchful state thing in the theme settings, though. In a module, it does seem to properly inherit in the editor UI, just not in the actual value that gets transmitted to HubL.
Some folks are going to be looking into it soon :slightly_smiling_face:
